sub_title: Senior Director of Performance Marketing at Booking.com
summary:
Ed is Senior Director of Performance Marketing at Booking.com, where he is responsible for paid search and meta search globally. He is committed to driving Booking.com's growth and performance marketing; helping make connected-travel easier and more accessible to everyone around the world; and having lots of fun nerding out along the way on all things performance, data, automation, content, customer experience, ppc, search, meta, and all the rest.

Prior to joining Booking.com, Ed led teams in digital/eCommerce, technology, performance marketing, and brand marketing at Dunelm, Skyscanner, and Wowcher/LivingSocial. He built, ran, and sold (in 2021) a private education business, and has advised several technology businesses on strategy and marketing since 2020. He started his career as a strategy consultant at OC&C in London after studying mathematics at Cambridge University for four years.

Ed recently moved to Amsterdam NL to work for Booking.com; moving from London UK, where he lived and worked for his early career. Born in the UK, Ed grew up in the UK and Switzerland (and Singapore and Zimbabwe as a young child) before returning to the UK for university and work. He enjoys skiing, sailing, bouldering, and exploring new places. He is a (sailing) UK RYA Yacthmaster Offshore and used to work for Professional Yacht Deliveries, delivering sailing yachts around the world in between projects and after university - now, he mostly sails for fun!

profile_positions.description:
Senior Director of Performance Marketing at Booking.com. Responsible for paid search (PPC) and meta search (price comparison) globally.

Part of Booking.com's overall extended leadership team.
profile_positions.title: Senior Director of Performance Marketing

profile_positions.description:
Wise, formerly TransferWise, is an online currency exchange and payments service that allows people to exchange currency using mid-market rates for a flat fee.

I advise on marketing strategy, from a financial impact and operational effectiveness perspective. Working with the finance and marketing teams in how and where to better assess and invest in marketing to continue driving Wise's impressive flywheel growth. Covering brand and performance marketing, strategy and finance considerations, tracking and attribution, and implementation in marketing channels.
profile_positions.title: Advisor

profile_positions.description:
Holiday Fox is a technology platform focused on the camping and experience sector, providing: an eCommerce B2B2C marketplace for campers to book stays, a B2B software suite of campsite management and booking tools, and white label booking widgets and white label out of the box websites / digital presence for campsites and similar businesses.

I'm a supporting advisor across growth and marketing strategy and execution. I also support on strategic positioning, commercial, and business model - ultimately helping Holiday Fox build towards a long term scale and profitable business.
profile_positions.title: Advisory Board Member

profile_positions.description:
Automata is a London based biotech company providing robotic automation solutions to the life sciences industry.

I supported and advised on strategy, commercial and market positioning, return on investment, and models and frameworks of how to articulate value to business partners, finance directors, lab directors in CROs, private and public labs, and investors. Covered genomics, pathology and diagnostics, synthetic biology, drug discovery, and more.
profile_positions.title: Advisor

profile_positions.description:
Dunelm is a FTSE250 homewares and furniture retailer based in UK. Enjoyed incredible online growth – one of the only store-retailers whose share price more than doubled through COVID pandemic – driven by online performance.

MY ROLE
Lead Dunelm’s eCommerce business and P&L in partnership with Digital Trading Director. Lead Dunelm's marketing function in partnership with Brand Marketing Director. Part of Dunelm’s Leadership Team (top 25 managers). Responsible for total web and digital consumer demand and traffic to website. Responsible for 1 of 5 company-wide tech change programs.

ECOMMERCE LEADERSHIP
Jointly accountable for Dunelm’s digital and eCommerce business and P&L; ownership shared with Digital Trading Director.

PERFORMANCE MARKETING LEADERSHIP
Accountable for all performance marketing at Dunelm on digital channels (paid search, paid social, etc, SEO, email, and CRM) and stores-based retention marketing (till based vouchers and loyalty incentives). Drove Dunelm’s incredible online growth during COVID pandemic, by increasing customer acquisition and improving customer retention and loyalty – more than doubling Dunelm’s web revenues.

TECH & CUSTOMER DATA LEADERSHIP
Accountable for 1 of Dunelm’s 5 Tech Focus Areas (ie, product engineering groups) investing in developing technology and data systems and infrastructure to understand our customer data, deepen our relationship with customers, and orchestration and tooling for marketing, web systems and customer data.
profile_positions.title: Performance Marketing & Digital Director

profile_positions.description:
Wentworth Education is an elite educational consultancy and tutoring agency.
•	Zero asset and zero employees; highly profitable; substantial six figure annual revenues
•	>200 freelance tutors; >500 high net worth clients across the globe; highly automated processes

Founder & Management. Built Wentworth Education in a light-touch scalable way, on the side of full-time employment.
•	Sale of Business. Sold the business to a trade buyer in 2021. Managed sale process from prospect list, to negotiation, to completion.
•	Management. 6 central team members: outsourced sales and client management to senior tutors with profit-share incentives aligned to overall business profitability and growth.
•	Technology. Automated business processes: contract creation and post sales, compliance, consolidated many-to-many invoicing and financial control, website hosting and CMS, database infrastructure, CRM, etc.
profile_positions.title: Founder & Director (Sold Business)

profile_positions.description:
Skyscanner is a leader in travel technology and is global B2B2C marketplace across the flights, hotels, and car-hire. One the world’s largest and fastest growing travel brands serving >100M unique monthly visitors across web and app. Acquired by Ctrip in November 2016 for USD1.74bn. Double digit YoY growth continues to outpace the industry. Evolving business model from search to retail. Expanding into hotels and cars from flights.

MY ROLE
Growth and Marketing Director with responsibility across many teams, projects, and functions in Skyscanner. Report to CMO; promoted after 1 year; one of the most senior marketers and business managers in Skyscanner. Responsibilities include:

PAID, REFERRAL, & APP MARKETING
Accountable for all paid performance marketing in Skyscanner; generating and fuelling new user growth and retention across all platforms and markets. Responsibilities include: (a) all biddable channels (eg: Google, Facebook, Yandex, Daum, Naver, ...); (b) referral marketing channels (affiliates, and B2B/API whitelabel integrations such as Yahoo, LonelyPlanet, TripAdvisor); and (c) app marketing towards install CAC and LTV.

PROD-ENG TRIBE LEAD
Tribe lead of c.5 squads and c.40 product managers and software engineers. Responsible for tribe strategy, and marketing expertise; partner with Product and Engineering tribe leads responsible for delivery.

MARKETING OPERATIONS
Established processes to provide due diligence and control to: spend, budgets, revenue, attribution, tracking, robust decision making, and delegated authorities.

TEAM LEADERSHIP
Manage globally distributed team of: c.25 paid marketing marketers; and c.10 data analysts, governance, and technology team members (excludes software tribe of c.50 product managers, data scientists, and software engineers across wider marketing stack). Transitioned teams from regional silos with inconsistent marketing laydowns to a global team with consistent and scalable marketing laydown and lean management style.
profile_positions.title: Senior Director, Marketing (Paid, Referral, Apps, Ops, MarTech)

profile_positions.description:
PROD-ENG TRIBE LEADERSHIP
Prod-Eng Tribe Lead (partnering with Engineering and Product Tribe Leads), of Tribe responsible for half of Skyscanner's marketing technology, as well as large sections of backend data-flow, tracking, and front-end microsites. Responsible for Tribe Strategy and marketing expertise, managing teams of marketing managers syndicated into prod-eng squads.

MARKETING LEADERSHIP
Paid Marketing Director (Google, Facebook, Display, Affiliates, etc.), inheriting fragmented team structure and marketing approach. Globalised and reorganised processes, campaigns, and decision making. Enabling both efficiencies of channel expertise and global scale - whilst keeping market-specific knowledge and team-member accountabilities. Improved operational and governance procedures, vastly improving accountability of decision making, finance integration with the team, robust decision making, and confidence from the executive team.

ROLE EXPANSION
Promoted after 1 year to Senior Director, and role expanded to include app marketing (ASO, paid, ...); overall strategy and integration of affiliate marketing with B2B whitelabel and API services for companies like TripAdvisor, Lonely Planet, and Bing; and marketing-wide initiatives on company OKRs, such as Hotels.
profile_positions.title: Director, Growth (Paid Marketing, Prod-Eng Tribe Lead)

profile_positions.description:
MY ROLE
Drove several growth/marketing department wide projects. For example: use of data in decision making; availability of granular booking level data in optimisation and return-on-investment calculations; improvements in budgeting and reporting processes in partnership with finance.

ROLE EXPANSION
Role quickly expanded to include: (a) Tribe Leadership for a prod-eng tribe working on marketing technology and enablement; and (b) Directorship for the paid (biddable and affiliate) marketing teams.
profile_positions.title: Director, Strategy & Operations

profile_positions.description:
Excalibur owns and operates two leading B2B2C eCommerce businesses in the UK: Wowcher and LivingSocial.
•	Pan sector eCommerce: shopping/retail (electronics, home, garden, beauty, etc.); travel (hotels, short breaks, and long haul); digital services (learning, gambling, etc.); and local services (spa, restaurants, activities, etc.)
•	B2C: Wowcher is a top 15 UK eRetail website with 5-7m monthly unique visitors (comScore); LivingSocial is top 100 with c.1m monthly unique visitors; broadcast billions of emails per annum and generate tens of millions of daily marketing impacts
•	B2B: Partner with c.15k SMEs to market their businesses, acquire new users, and grow their top line revenue

Marketing Director with responsibility across full stack marketing (brand and digital); growth, product innovation, and revenue optimisation; and business insight, corporate strategy, and finance
•	Manage a team of 15, with 6 direct reports; one of the top executives in the business; report to the CEO
•	Full stack marketing across: CRM/email, TV, PR, SEO, text search ads, product listing ads, display, retargeting, organic and paid social, affiliates, mobile app install, peer-to-peer referral, etc.
•	Built and scaled net-new subscriber acquisition campaigns having now acquired tens of millions of UK GDPR compliant email subscribers; based on brand and direct response marketing across all channels.
•	Developed behavioural recommendation engines based on past user behaviour (multiple billions of data points) to provide 1-to-1 personalised product recommendations to consumers via email/CRM and live on-site.
•	Accountable for data science, product innovation, and testing; with a fail-fast, AB testing, mentality. Examples include development of special product modules on-site (recently viewed, complementary products, etc.), cognitive prompts, and 1-to-1 product recommendations.
•	Support CEO with strategy, corporate finance, special projects, board meetings, and management reporting.
profile_positions.title: Marketing Director

profile_positions.description:
Initially focused on acquisition marketing, brand marketing, data analytics, web analytics, reporting, and general management of cashback business.

Successive role expansions to include CRM-optimisation, personalisation of messaging, onsite AB-testing and optimisation, product innovation on website and email, and corporate strategy support for CEO and CFO. See above for more details.

The most senior marketing manager in the business, reporting to CEO. Promoted after two years.
profile_positions.title: Head Of Marketing

profile_positions.description:
Accountable for acquisition of net new email address signups and consumer engagement. Focused on overall return on investment from lifetime-value and cost-of-acquisition of signups and engagement.

Accountable for business reporting, data, and analytics (database and web-analytics) using SQL, Excel, Adobe Omniture/SiteCatalyst.

On secondment from OC&C Strategy Consultants. These additional responsibilities added on top of Cashback GM role. Became permanent employee in March 2015 with further role expansions and promotions.
profile_positions.title: Head of Acquisition Marketing (Secondment from OC&C)

profile_positions.description:
Accountable for P&L of Wowcher's cashback business - a start-up incubated within Wowcher. Managed team members responsible for product and planning, sales, marketing, inventory management, CRM and email programs, content creation, and back-end operational administration.

On secondment from OC&C Strategy Consultants. Additional responsibilities across acquisition marketing and reporting added in November 2014, whilst still under secondment from OC&C. Became permanent employee in March 2015 with further role expansions and promotions.
profile_positions.title: General Manager of Cashback Business (Secondment from OC&C)

profile_positions.description:
OC&C is a top tier strategy consultancy specialising in strategic advice to senior management in large corporations in the Retail, FMCG, TMT and B2B Services sectors.
•	Experience in: retail, FMCG, licensed betting, hotels, pensions, insurance and warranties, education, media, industrial chemicals, information services and marketing.
•	Responsibilities include managing project work streams, leading teams of junior consultants, presenting recommendations and commercial insights to clients and internal managers.

30 projects - 10 due diligences and 20 corporate strategy and operation improvements. Highlights include:
•	Due Diligence. IPO support for top European Used Car Logistics and Remarketing firm.  Led team of 6, developed market and competitor fact base across multiple European geographies. Helped construct briefing documents for bookrunner meetings and IPO prospectus.
•	Due Diligence. Buy side diligence of top UK provider of extended warranties. Responsibility for 50% of project, managing 4 analysts. Diligence of market conditions and management’s sales targets. Built revenue and cash flow forecast model. Modelled valuation sensitivities for PE buy-out model.
•	Corporate Strategy. Revenue opportunity analysis for top 2 UK logistics and LCV & HGV fleet operator. Led team of 4, reviewed the external market and identified strategic niche in market, asset capacity analysis proving capability of existing assets to sell to external clients.
•	Corporate Strategy. Design of store rollout plan for top tier licensed betting operator. Statistical analysis of current store estate performance and dependency on local demographic and company data achieving highly accurate predictive model. Extrapolated model to identify sites for future store locations and built dynamic Excel based tool / user interface for client use when planning and implementing future store rollouts. Methodology has since been used by OC&C for sale and delivery of store rollout projects for other clients.
profile_positions.title: Consultant
